tool.name: CreateTerrainAwareLayers

param.name: in_dem
param.dialogReference:
The input DEM to be used to generate the slope and aspect rasters and the contour lines.

Ideally, the extent of this DEM aligns with your cartographic area of interest. If not, you can use the 'Processing Extent' input to ensure that the output of the tool is constrained to a specific extent.
param.pythonReference:
The input DEM to be used to generate the slope and aspect rasters and the contour lines.

Ideally, the extent of this DEM aligns with your cartographic area of interest. If not, you can use the 'Processing Extent' input to ensure that the output of the tool is constrained to a specific extent.

param.name: polygons
param.dialogReference: Output terrain polygons that depict the areas of intersection between the slope and aspect of the terrain.
param.pythonReference: Output terrain polygons that depict the areas of intersection between the slope and aspect of the terrain.

param.name: map_extent
param.dialogReference:
Determines the extent of the geoprocessing operations conducted by this tool.

  • DEM_EXTENT - The processing extent of the tool will match that of the input DEM. This is the default. *If this option is selected, ensure that the extent of the DEM matches the intended area of interest. Using a DEM that exceeds your area of interest may skew the results of the slope classification.

  • EXTENT_LAYER - The processing extent of the tool will match that of the layer provided. This is useful if the DEM exceeds your cartographic area of interest.
param.pythonReference:
Determines the extent of the geoprocessing operations conducted by this tool.

  • DEM_EXTENT - The processing extent of the tool will match that of the input DEM. This is the default. *If this option is selected, ensure that the extent of the DEM matches the intended area of interest. Using a DEM that exceeds your area of interest may skew the results of the slope classification.

  • EXTENT_LAYER - The processing extent of the tool will match that of a supplemental layer provided. This is useful if the DEM exceeds your cartographic area of interest.

param.name: extent_layer
param.dialogReference: Polygon layer that defines the extent of your cartographic area of interest. Can be used to restrict the processing of the tool to a specific extent other than the input DEM.
param.pythonReference: Polygon layer that defines the extent of your cartographic area of interest. Can be used to restrict the processing of the tool to a specific extent other than the input DEM.

param.name: min_poly_area
param.dialogReference:
Defines the minimum area criteria that must be met by the groups of raster cells within the slope and aspect rasters during generalization. Raster cell regions smaller than this area will be generalized during processing.

This criteria does not apply to the output terrain polygons as they are the result of an intersection and they may be small fragments, however this generalization aims to reduce the fragmentation of the output datasets.
param.pythonReference:
Defines the minimum area criteria that must be met by the groups of raster cells within the slope and aspect rasters during generalization. Raster cell regions smaller than this area will be generalized during processing.

This criteria does not apply to the output terrain polygons as they are the result of an intersection and they may be small fragments, however this generalization aims to reduce the fragmentation of the output datasets.

param.name: focal_nbhd
param.dialogReference: Define the focal neighbourhood size of a focal statistics operation (circle mean). This smooths the input DEM.
param.pythonReference: Define the focal neighbourhood size of a focal statistics operation (circle mean). This smooths the input DEM.

param.name: azimuth
param.dialogReference: Defines the azimuth (light direction) for the aspect processing. This can be used to define the light source of the tool when your map is rotated to some degree other than north.
param.pythonReference: Define the focal neighbourhood size of a focal statistics operation (circle mean). This smooths the input DEM.

tool.summary: Scripted series of geoprocessing tools that create a slope and aspect raster from an input DEM. These terrain rasters are utilized to enhance a new set of contour lines and terrain polygons with the characteristics of the underlying terrain. These outputs can be style via the 'Style Terrain Aware Layers' tool to achieve a variety of artistic cartographic relief.
